title.native: 魔術士オーフェンはぐれ旅

description:
Orphen is a powerful Sorcerer who’s notoriously lazy. But everything changes when he discovers a way to save his sister who was turned into a dragon during their days at the academy. Now he’ll stop at nothing to save her, even if he has to go it alone!

(Source: Funimation)

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉田玲子) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Yoshida)

Yoshida has written and supervised numerous scripts for anime series, live-action dramas and films. Her major works include [Kaleido Star](https://anilist.co/anime/427), [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477), [Maria-sama ga Miteru](https://anilist.co/anime/158), [D.Gray-man](https://anilist.co/anime/1482), [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680), [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/anime/7674) and [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131). In more recent works, she has supervised the screenplays for [Majestic Prince](https://anilist.co/anime/15863), [Non Non Biyori](https://anilist.co/anime/17549), [A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741), [Tamako Market](https://anilist.co/anime/16417), [Yowamushi Pedal](https://anilist.co/anime/18179) and [Castle Town Dandelion](https://anilist.co/anime/20951). In films, she wrote the screenplay for Ghibli's [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597), the original films that would make up [Digimon: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2961), Kyoto Animation’s hit anime film [A Silent Voice](https://anilist.co/anime/20954), and the film adaptations of Osamu Tezuka's [Buddha](https://anilist.co/anime/7014), the last one's [second film](https://anilist.co/anime/20500) was given a stamp of approval by the Dalai Lama.

Among her works, she was recognized for Best Screenplay/Original Work for [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131) at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014, and she won another Best Screenplay/Original Work award in 2017. In 2018, she wrote the screenplay for [Violet Evergarden](https://anilist.co/anime/21827) which aired on TV in Japan and is licensed by Netflix.

Yoshida also wrote the story for the manga series [Tokyo Mew Mew](https://anilist.co/manga/30554).

(Source: Wikipedia)

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/258364/)._

Affiliated with [Studio DEEN](https://anilist.co/studio/37/Studio-DEEN).

**Height:** 165cm 
**Favorite color:** Black
**Graduated:** Meiji University

**[Artist Profile (Add9th)](https://add9th.co.jp/profile/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MorikuBorn)**

Shoutarou Morikubo is a Japanese voice actor who has been active in anime, drama CDs, and video games. He's the founder and representative director of [Add9th](https://add9th.co.jp/). He has additionally released song singles, a CD album, and a concert DVD. He was formerly affiliated with I'm Enterprise and VIMS.

In 2018, he formed the musical unit [buzz☆Vibes](https://anilist.co/staff/160730/buzzVibes) with Japanese multitalent [Shinnosuke](https://anilist.co/staff/160731/Shinnosuke).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Shinnosuke_Syn)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/shinscapade/)__

__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

__Shinnosuke__ is a Japanese artist, producer, composer, writer, arranger, remixer, DJ, painter, etc, who is also known as a member of the band SOUL'd OUT (1999-) and the musical unit [buzz★Vibes](https://anilist.co/staff/160730/buzzVibes) (2018-) alongside [Shoutarou Morikubo](https://anilist.co/staff/95178), otherwise known by stage name M.K.B.

__Genres:__ J-Pop, Jazz, Funk

__[Website (Lantis)](https://www.lantis.jp/artist/buzzvibes/bio.html/)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0jRwWRogAKJ8c82AnAplNC)__

__Introduction:__
buzz☆Vibes is a Japanese musical duo under record label Lantis, who made their first appearence in anime when they performed the opening theme song to the remake of 1998-1999 anime [Sorcerous Stabber Orphen](https://anilist.co/anime/101367/Majutsushi-Orphen-Hagure-Tabi/).

__Members:__
- [Shoutarou Morikubo](https://anilist.co/staff/95178/Shoutarou-Morikubo) (森久保祥太郎), also known as M.K.B - vocalist, in-charge of lyrics
- [Shinnosuke](https://anilist.co/staff/160731/Shinnosuke) - keyboardist, in-charge of chorus, composition and arrangement

__[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/people/%E5%9C%9F%E7%94%B0%E6%8B%93%E9%83%8E/100023407530279)__

__Residency:__ Itabashi-ku, Tokyo, Japan
__Graduated:__ SHOBI College of Music

__Takurou Tsuchida__ is a Japanese keyboardist and composer.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Shinnosuke_Syn)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/shinscapade/)__

__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

__Shinnosuke__ is a Japanese artist, producer, composer, writer, arranger, remixer, DJ, painter, etc, who is also known as a member of the band SOUL'd OUT (1999-) and the musical unit [buzz★Vibes](https://anilist.co/staff/160730/buzzVibes) (2018-) alongside [Shoutarou Morikubo](https://anilist.co/staff/95178), otherwise known by stage name M.K.B.
__Masayuki Fukutomi__ is a Japanese guitarist, composer and arranger,

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Shinnosuke_Syn)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/shinscapade/)__

__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

__Shinnosuke__ is a Japanese artist, producer, composer, writer, arranger, remixer, DJ, painter, etc, who is also known as a member of the band SOUL'd OUT (1999-) and the musical unit [buzz★Vibes](https://anilist.co/staff/160730/buzzVibes) (2018-) alongside [Shoutarou Morikubo](https://anilist.co/staff/95178), otherwise known by stage name M.K.B.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/531004994) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=shuu_sugita)

Originating from [Studio DEEN](https://anilist.co/studio/37/). Currently affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858).
